source: U.S. Department of Labor - O*NET Database

basicSkills.name: Basic Skills
basicSkills.description: Developed capacities that facilitate learning or the more rapid acquisition of knowledge

skills.name: Reading Comprehension
skills.definition: Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.

skills.name: Active Listening
skills.definition: Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.

skills.name: Writing
skills.definition: Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.

skills.name: Speaking
skills.definition: Talking to others to convey information effectively.

skills.name: Mathematics
skills.definition: Using mathematics to solve problems.

skills.name: Science
skills.definition: Using scientific rules and methods to solve problems.

skills.name: Critical Thinking
skills.definition: Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems.

skills.name: Active Learning
skills.definition: Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.

skills.name: Learning Strategies
skills.definition: Selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things.

skills.name: Monitoring
skills.definition: Monitoring/Assessing performance of yourself, other individuals, or organizations to make improvements or take corrective action.

crossFunctionalSkills.name: Cross-Functional Skills
crossFunctionalSkills.description: Developed capacities that facilitate performance of activities that occur across jobs

skills.name: Social Perceptiveness
skills.definition: Being aware of others' reactions and understanding why they react as they do.

skills.name: Coordination
skills.definition: Adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.

skills.name: Persuasion
skills.definition: Persuading others to change their minds or behavior.

skills.name: Negotiation
skills.definition: Bringing others together and trying to reconcile differences.

skills.name: Instructing
skills.definition: Teaching others how to do something.

skills.name: Service Orientation
skills.definition: Actively looking for ways to help people.

skills.name: Complex Problem Solving
skills.definition: Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.

skills.name: Operations Analysis
skills.definition: Analyzing needs and product requirements to create a design.

skills.name: Technology Design
skills.definition: Generating or adapting equipment and technology to serve user needs.

skills.name: Equipment Selection
skills.definition: Determining the kind of tools and equipment needed to do a job.

skills.name: Installation
skills.definition: Installing equipment, machines, wiring, or programs to meet specifications.

skills.name: Programming
skills.definition: Writing computer programs for various purposes.

skills.name: Operations Monitoring
skills.definition: Watching gauges, dials, or other indicators to make sure a machine is working properly.

skills.name: Operation and Control
skills.definition: Controlling operations of equipment or systems.

skills.name: Equipment Maintenance
skills.definition: Performing routine maintenance on equipment and determining when and what kind of maintenance is needed.

skills.name: Troubleshooting
skills.definition: Determining causes of operating errors and deciding what to do about it.

skills.name: Repairing
skills.definition: Repairing machines or systems using the needed tools.

skills.name: Quality Control Analysis
skills.definition: Conducting tests and inspections of products, services, or processes to evaluate quality or performance.

skills.name: Judgment and Decision Making
skills.definition: Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.

skills.name: Systems Analysis
skills.definition: Determining how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes.

skills.name: Systems Evaluation
skills.definition: Identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the system.

skills.name: Time Management
skills.definition: Managing one's own time and the time of others.

skills.name: Management of Financial Resources
skills.definition: Determining how money will be spent to get the work done, and accounting for these expenditures.

skills.name: Management of Material Resources
skills.definition: Obtaining and seeing to the appropriate use of equipment, facilities, and materials needed to do certain work.

skills.name: Management of Personnel Resources
skills.definition: Motivating, developing, and directing people as they work, identifying the best people for the job.
